name: Tradition
uniques: Greatly increases the rate of border expansion of cities by 25%.
Unlocks the Hanging Gardens
Receive +3 Culture in the Capital.

policies.name: Productive Environment
policyEffects: +15% Production when building Wonders (any Era).
+1 Happiness for every 10 Citizens in a City.

policies.name: Garrisoned City
policyEffects: Garrisoned units cost no maintenance and cities with a garrison gain 50% Ranged Combat Strength.

policies.name: Legal System
policyEffects: Provides a free culture building in your first 4 cities.
Provides a Courtroom after Guilds was discovered.

policies.name: Under One Man
policyEffects: +1 Gold and -1 Unhappiness Unhappiness for every 2 Citizens in the Capital.

policies.name: Agriculture Landlords
uniques: +10% Growth and +2 Food in the Capital.

policies.name: Tradition Completion
uniques: A free Aqueduct in your first four cities.
It also allows the purchase of Great Engineers with Faith starting in the Industrial Era.

name: Liberty
uniques: Unlocks the Pyramid
Receive +1 Culture in every city.

policies.name: Wonders of Engineering
policyEffects: +1 Production in every city
+5% Production in cities when constructing Historical Wonders.

policies.name: Citizenship
policyEffects: Tile improvement construction rate increased by 25%.
A Worker appears near the Capital.

policies.name: Educated Ones
policyEffects: +1 Happiness for each City you own connected to the Capital
-5% Unhappiness Unhappiness from Citizens in non-occupied Cities.
Unlocks Classical University.

policies.name: Under Multiple Men
policyEffects: Each city you found will increase the Culture cost of policies by 33% less than normal.
Start a 6-turn Golden Age.

policies.name: Collective Ruling
uniques: Speeds the training of Settlers by 50% in the Capital.
A free Settler appears near the Capital.

uniques: A free Great People of choice

name: Honor
uniques: Unlocks the Statue of Zeus
Receive +33% Combat Bonus against Barbarians.
Notifications will be provided when new Barbarian Encampments spawn in revealed territory.
Gain +5 Culture for the empire from each barbarian unit killed

policies.name: Warrior Code
policyEffects: +15% Production when training Melee units
A Great General appears outside the Capital.
Great General earned 50% faster

policies.name: Discipline
policyEffect: +15% Combat Strength for Melee units, which have another military unit in an adjacent tile.

policies.name: Military Caste
policyEffects: Each City with a garrison increases local city's Happiness and Culture by 2.

policies.name: Military Tradition
policyEffects: Military Units gain 50% more Experience from combat.

policies.name: Professional Army
uniques: Gold cost of upgrading Military Units reduced by 33%
+1 Happiness in Local City
+1 Happiness from every defensive buildings.
Construct Barracks, Armories and Military School 50% faster.

uniques: Recieve +5 Gold for each enemy units killed by your units.

name: Piety
uniques: Unlocks the Great Mosque of Djenne
Reduce the time to build Cultural buildings by 15%, Shrine and Temple by 50%
Notifications will be provided when new Barbarian Encampments spawn in revealed territory.
Gain +5 Culture for the empire from each barbarian unit killed

policies.name: Organize Religion
policyEffects: +1 Happiness from Monuments, Temples, and Monasteries.
+1 Faith from Shrine and Temple.

policies.name: Mandate of Heaven
policyEffect: 50% of excessHappiness added each turn to the amount of Culture that may be spent on Social Policies.

policies.name: Bleesings of God
policyEffects: Temples increase a City's Gold output by 25%.
Holy Site provides +3 Gold.

policies.name: Religious Tolerance
policyEffects: Reduces the Culture cost of future Policies by 10%.
Cities with a majority religion also get the Pantheon belief bonus of the second most popular religion.

policies.name: Social Religious Security
uniques: Gives 1 free Social Policy.
+1 Culture from Monuments, Temples, and Monasteries.
Mandate of Heaven
Religious Reformation

policies.name: Religious Reformation
uniques: Culture increased by 33% in all cities which have built a World Wonder and the empire immediately enters a Golden Age.
If  you founded a religion, gain a bonus Reformation belief.

uniques: Reduce the Culture cost of future policies by 10%
Provide a 20% discount on all purchase of religion units and buildings with Faith.
Holy Site provide +3 Gold and +3 Culture
A Great Prophet appears.

name: Patronage
uniques: Unlocks the Forbidden Palace
Cause Influece with City-State to decrease 25% slower than normal.

policies.name: Philanthropy
policyEffects: Gifts of Golds to a City-State generate 25% more Influence.

policies.name: Suzerainty
policyEffect: Resting point for Influence Influence level with all City-States is increased by 20.

policies.name: Scholasticism
policyEffects: All City-States which are Allies provide a Science bonus equal to 25% of what they produce for themselves.

policies.name: Cultural Diplomacy
policyEffects: Quantity of Resources gifted by City-States increased by 100%.
Happiness from gifted Luxuries increased by 50%.

uniques: Allied City-States will occasionally gift you Great People.
+2 Gold for trade routes with City-States.
